name: Recurring Revenue and Customer Retention
question: Why is recurring revenue considered a safety net for startups?

choices.choice: It requires customers to make large one-time payments.
It provides a predictable stream of income from customers.
It eliminates the need for customer service.

explanation: Recurring revenue is considered a safety net because it offers a predictable and consistent income stream, with customers paying on a regular basis, which is vital for the financial stability of a startup.

name: Benefits of Recurring Revenue Model
question: What is a major advantage of the recurring revenue model over the one-time purchase model?
explanation: The recurring revenue model has the major advantage of offering a higher customer lifetime value compared to the one-time purchase model, due to the consistent income generated over time from each customer.

name: Importance of Customer Retention
question: What happens if a startup has a high churn rate?

choices.choice: It can maintain a stable income without acquiring new customers.
It increases its customer lifetime value significantly.
It loses customers and income over time, risking the business's profitability.

explanation: A high churn rate means a startup is losing customers at a fast pace, leading to a continuous drain on customers and income, which can significantly risk the business's profitability and sustainability.

name: Effects of Churn Rate on Customer Base
question: What would be the effect on the customer base by the end of the year if a startup begins with 100 customers and has a monthly churn rate of 5%?

choices.choice: It would remain unchanged at 100 customers.
It would decrease to roughly 54 customers.
It would decrease to below 20 customers.

explanation: Starting with 100 customers and experiencing a monthly churn rate of 5% means losing about 5% of the customer base each month. By the end of the year, this compound loss leaves the startup with roughly 54 customers, almost half of the initial amount.
